meanings.definition: To join or attach by stitches
meanings.sent1: She sewed the buttons onto the shirt.
meanings.sent2: My grandma sewed a beautiful quilt for me.
meanings.sent3: The cat sewed together a cozy bed from scraps of fabric.
meanings.sent4: Her words sewed a sense of unity among the team.
meanings.sent5: The tailor sewed the intricate design flawlessly.

meanings.definition: To make or repair by stitching
meanings.sent1: He sewed a patch onto his torn jeans.
meanings.sent2: The seamstress sewed a new hem on the dress.
meanings.sent3: The robot sewed a torn wire back together with precision.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness sewed broken hearts back into one.
meanings.sent5: The surgeon sewed up the wound carefully.
